newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel begins work at East Jerusalem site.
newsitem.headline: Israel begins work at East Jerusalem site.

text.p: Israel began work on Tuesday at the site of a planned Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem and prepared for a violent Palestinian backlash.

Witnesses said a surveyor took measurements at Jabal Abu Ghneim, a pine-covered hilltop called Har Homa by Israel. Israeli soldiers ringed the site and Jerusalem police were on high alert for possible Palestinian violence.
Trucks carrying four bulldozers arrived at the site under heavy police escort as a military helicopter flew overhead, the witnesses said.
Israeli contractor Sasson Shem-Tov, overseeing the work, told Reuters that roads would be built in the first stage of the project to construct 6,500 homes for Jews.
The PLO has condemned the project as a violation of its peace deals with the Jewish state.
Israel has warned the Palestinian Authority, in charge of parts of the West Bank and Gaza Strip, it will respond strongly to any outbreak of violence.
